intro: Couepia macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaf couepia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and is often found in humid lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that can grow up to 30 cm in length. Its flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and typically have five petals. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release numerous small, hairy seeds.
